Both SUMO E2 conjugating enzyme Ubc9 and E3 ligase protein inhibitor of activated STAT3 (Pias3) are targets for S-nitrosation
Pias3 associates and colocalizes with Trim32, a Ubiquitin E3 ligase.

PIAS3 binds to Tel and stimulates sumoylation of K11 in the nucleus.PIAS3 may have a dual, context-dependent influence on Tel; it mediates Tel sumoylation, but it also augments Tel's repressive function in a sumoylation-independent fashion.

This study suggests a link between PIAS3 and nuclear pyruvate kinase.

PIAS3 is expressed in NSCLC cell lines and its over-expression decreased STAT3 transcriptional activity, decreased proliferation of NSCLC cells and when used in conjunction with EGFR inhibitors, increased the anti-proliferative effects.

novel transcription factor binding partners for PIAS3 including ETS, EGR1, NR1I2, and GATA1 were identified.

PIAS3 is a novel regulator of ErbB4 receptor tyrosine kinase, controlling its nuclear sequestration and function.

Downregulation of PIAS3 is associated with gastric adenocarcinogenesis.

PIAS3 may be a potential biomarker target for early cancer detection and therapeutic of human colorectal cancer.

PIAS3 may serve as a biomarker for predicting hormone therapy stratification, although it is limited to those breast cancer patients receiving hormone therapy.

The results revealed that although the expression levels of SOCS1, SOCS3 and, in particular, pSHP2, tend to decrease in the four types of astrocytomas, PIAS3 downregulation is more negatively correlated with STAT3 activation in the stepwise progress of astrocytomas and would indicate an unfavorable outcome.

SHP2, SOCS3 and PIAS3 levels are reduced in medulloblastomas in vivo and in vitro, of which PIAS3 downregulation is more reversely correlated with STAT3 activation. In resveratrol-suppressed medulloblastoma cells with STAT3 downregulation and decreased incidence of STAT3 nuclear translocation, PIAS3 is upregulated, the SHP2 level remains unchanged and SOCS3 is downregulated.
TRIM8 activates STAT3 by suppressing the expression of PIAS3, an inhibitor of STAT3, most likely through E3-mediated ubiquitination and proteasomal degradation.

PIAS3-mediated feedback loops control cell proliferation and function as robust driving forces for Colitis-associated colorectal cancer (CAC) progression.

Study reports that SMAD6 is overexpressed in nuclei of glioma cells, which correlates with poor patient survival and regulates STAT3 activity via negatively regulating PIAS3. Mechanically, SMAD6 interacts directly with PIAS3, and this interaction is mediated through the Mad homology 2 domain of SMAD6 and the Ring domain of PIAS3.

a positive feedback loop between miR-181b and STAT3 that regulated the Warburg effect in colon cancer was also demonstrated. This study suggested miR-181b/PIAS3/STAT3 axis as a novel target for colon cancer treatment.
This study identified miR-18a as a suppressor of PIAS3 expression that is upregulated in malignant mesothelioma cells and whose inhibition can increase PIAS3 expression and suppress STAT3 activity.
PIAS genes as disease markers in bipolar disorder.
miR-199a-5p promotes proliferation and metastasis and epithelial-mesenchymal transition through targeting PIAS3 in cervical carcinoma.

LncRNA FOXD2-AS1 promotes cell proliferation and invasion of fibroblast-like synoviocytes by regulation of miR-331-3p/PIAS3 pathway in rheumatoid arthritis.

name: protein inhibitor of activated STAT 3
other_names: protein inhibitor of activated STAT protein 3

reactome.name: SUMO E3 ligases SUMOylate target proteins
Formation of Incision Complex in GG-NER

wikipathways.name: Regulatory circuits of the STAT3 signaling pathway
Interactions between immune cells and microRNAs in tumor microenvironment

summary: This gene encodes a member of the PIAS [protein inhibitor of activated STAT (signal transducer and activator of transcription)] family of transcriptional modulators. The protein functions as a SUMO (small ubiquitin-like modifier)-E3 ligase which catalyzes the covalent attachment of a SUMO protein to specific target substrates. It directly binds to several transcription factors and either blocks or enhances their activity. Alternatively spliced transcript variants of this gene have been identified, but the full-length nature of some of these variants has not been determined. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
